text: Another sub - theme that emerged from the literature was the impact of globalization on local preparedness , prevention strategies , but more importantly , on the attribution of blame for the spread of the outbreak . While there is emphasis , in the narrative on SARs , for municipal governments to consider the globalized nature of the outbreak ; ( Keil and Ali 2007 ) , consistent with the politics of epidemics literature , which asserts that blame is typically placed on cultural and ethnic minority groups , significant blame was placed on the Asian - Canadian community .
